meanings.definition: A book containing the daily service of the Roman Catholic Church.
meanings.sent1: The priest carried his brevier to the church every morning.
meanings.sent2: She found solace in reading the brevier during her quiet moments.
meanings.sent3: The brevier seemed to whisper ancient prayers as it was opened.
meanings.sent4: The brevier was a key to unlocking the mysteries of faith.
meanings.sent5: The worn brevier held centuries of devotion within its pages.

meanings.definition: A type size smaller than minion.
meanings.sent1: The text in the brevier was tiny but clear to read.
meanings.sent2: The brevier font size made the text look elegant on the page.
meanings.sent3: She joked that only elves could comfortably read such a brevier.
meanings.sent4: The brevier letters danced like ants across the paper.
meanings.sent5: The brevier size challenged her eyes but not her determination to read.
